alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 04 at 7:28PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CROCKETT COUNTY THROUGH 815 PM CDT... At 727 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405, or 16 miles north of Pandale, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Ozona, The Intersection Of Us 190 And Highway 163, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405, The Intersection Of Highway 163 And Ranch Road 1973, and The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 345 and 379. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
